statement: "I've supported every investigation (into Hurricane Katrina) and ways of finding out how – what caused the tragedy. I've met with people on the ground. I've met with the governor."
ruling_headline: With two notable exceptions

ruling_link_text: Navy's record unblemished
statement: "The U.S. Navy has sailed ships around the world for 60 years with nuclear power plants on them and we've never had an accident."
ruling_headline: Navy's record unblemished

ruling_link_text: McCain overstates good news out of Iraq
statement_context: a town hall meeting in Nashville, Tenn.
statement: "Casualties and deaths are at (their) lowest point since literally the beginning" of the war.
ruling_headline: McCain overstates good news out of Iraq

ruling_link_text: Hussein did say he hoped to get WMD
statement: When the United States invaded Iraq, Saddam Hussein wanted to acquire weapons of mass destruction, and "he said so himself after his capture."
ruling_headline: Hussein did say he hoped to get WMD

ruling_link_text: Obama and Bush found common ground
statement: "Obama voted to support President Bush between 40 and 50 percent of the time over the past two years."
ruling_headline: Obama and Bush found common ground

ruling_link_text: McCain's off on Iraq details
statement: "We have drawn down to presurge levels. Basra, Mosul and now Sadr City are quiet and it's long and it's tough and there will be setbacks."
ruling_headline: McCain's off on Iraq details

ruling_link_text: McCain leads in Iraq trips 8-1
statement_context: a town hall meeting in Reno, Nev.
statement: "Sen. Obama has been to Iraq once."
ruling_headline: McCain leads in Iraq trips 8-1

ruling_link_text: He has said it again and again
statement: "Sen. Obama has declared, and repeatedly reaffirmed his intention to meet the president of Iran without any preconditions."
ruling_headline: He has said it again and again

ruling_link_text: McCain twists Obama's words
statement: Iran "might not be a superpower, but the threat the government of Iran poses is anything but 'tiny,'" as Obama says.
ruling_headline: McCain twists Obama's words

ruling_link_text: In protest, Obama voted against
statement: "Obama himself voted against funding our nation's veterans and troops in the field during a time of war."
ruling_headline: In protest, Obama voted against

ruling_link_text: They have. Yours, in fact
statement: "They (Clinton and Obama) have never to my knowledge been involved in legislation nor hearings nor engagement on this issue (climate change)."
ruling_headline: They have. Yours, in fact

ruling_link_text: Praise, but not a formal endorsement
statement_context: a media availability in Little Rock, Ark.
statement: "It is just a fact that Hamas, apparently the North American spokesperson, is endorsing Senator Obama."
ruling_headline: Praise, but not a formal endorsement

ruling_link_text: First in health spending, but not far ahead
statement_context: a campaign stop at Miami children's hospital
statement: "We spend a staggering amount of money on health care — over $2-trillion and almost twice as much as any other country per person."
ruling_headline: First in health spending, but not far ahead

ruling_link_text: His percentage is right; his amount is not
statement: "My friend, we have increased the size of government by some 40 percent just in the last few years."
ruling_headline: His percentage is right; his amount is not

ruling_link_text: To score a point, McCain misses the point
statement: Rev. Wright said "that al-Qaida and the American flag were the same flags."
ruling_headline: To score a point, McCain misses the point

ruling_link_text: Holiday much more costly than McCain suggests
statement_context: an interview on the Fox News Channel.
statement: McCain says the price of a gas tax "holiday" would be about the same as "a Bridge to Nowhere (or) another pork barrel project."
ruling_headline: Holiday much more costly than McCain suggests

ruling_link_text: Wright's culture of war comparison
statement: The Rev. Wright compared "the United States Marine Corps with Roman legionnaires who were responsible for the death of our Savior."
ruling_headline: Wright's culture of war comparison

ruling_link_text: McCain stretches on who gets hit
statement: Barack Obama "wants to nearly double the capital gains tax" increasing taxes on "mutual funds, 401(k)s" for "policemen, firemen, nurses."
ruling_headline: McCain stretches on who gets hit

ruling_link_text: One major tax cut, then lots of raises
statement: After Reagan took office, "we didn't raise taxes and we didn't cut entitlements. What we did was we cut taxes."
ruling_headline: One major tax cut, then lots of raises

ruling_link_text: Not enough to matter
statement: If the U.S. stops adding to the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, it "will lessen worldwide demand for oil" and reduce prices.
ruling_headline: Not enough to matter
